attributes.action: To fund a national memorial to remember all those who we have lost to Covid-19.
attributes.additional_details:
The National Memorial Arboretum have specific criteria and those who have lost their lives to this virus cannot be named there under these rules. 

This is an opportunity to honour those we have lost and never forget the tragedy of this pandemic. The government has supported many other memorials in the past and with your signatures we’re hoping this will be supported to!
attributes.background: So many families including ours have lost a loved one in the UK to this pandemic. I am calling on the government to fund a memorial that honours every life lost. Specifically by creating a monument that lists the name of every person who has died in this pandemic.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign these petitions calling for the same action:

A memorial for NHS, care, allied professionals, who die as a result of COVID:19: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/313328

Create a National Covid-19 Key worker memorial Commemorate the fallen: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/315516

Commission a Memorial Plaque to honour and remember UK victims of the Covid-19: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/310097
